author: @JamiClayt0n
text: Do you have any videos/resources on how a small business would operate under socialism? This is one area I've struggled to figure out and I'd like to be more informed/armed in arguments against capitalism lol. I understand nationalizing large industry such as oil and gas, but like I said I don't really get the small business part. Thanks!

replies.author: @MrOzzification
replies.text:
1) Under socialism your likely to run a worker co-op (if not a centrally planned economy), which is the fastest to demonstrate not only a democratic workplace but also what collective ownership actually looks like.

There's plenty of videos on youtube on how worker co-ops or workplace democracy works.

2) That said, co-ops are not a final solution. They're fine for the transitionary phase and primarily for letting common folk get a hands-on experience of collective ownership and real democracy.

author: @hewhomustnotbenamed5912
text:
I used to see syndicalism as  something that could only be used to gain concessions.
But this video helped me realize what I should have already known, as I am a great fan of Morales.
Syndicalism worked in Bolivia. It probably worked in Venezuela to I just don't know about how Chavez got most of his coverage from unions (correct me I'm wrong, as the Venezuela bit is just a guess).

I now believe the best way for many nations to achieve revolution is through syndicalism combined with immediate preparation of defences against incoming coups and sanctions.
